root.description: The rotting, wooden door creaks as you push it open. You are in a narrow hall lit by torches.

exit.description: To the north, stairs lead upward.
exit.detailedDescription: The stairs are made of stone slabs. The air above is foul.

exit.description: To the east, the door to your dungeon cell is open.
exit.detailedDescription: The rotting, wooden door hangs on rope hinges. The fastening rope has been cut, and hangs from a hook on the wall.

exit.description: To the south, stairs lead downward.
exit.detailedDescription: The stairs are made of stone slabs. The air is chill, but touchligh can be seen at the lower landing.

exit.description: To the west, across the hall, there is a closed door. A lock holds the door closed.
exit.detailedDescription: The door build of solid wood and its hinges are iron. Pressing your ear to the door, you hear whimpering within.

prop.description: The walls are of grey stone.
prop.detailedDescription: Large stones are press into the wet, dirt walls. At each door, the stone are scratched and stained.

prop.description: The floor is of uneven, but solid dirt.
prop.detailedDescription: It has seen much use and has been pressed solid by heavy boots.

prop.description: A grey and hairy creature clad in rusted mail is sprawled out, motionless on the ground.
prop.detailedDescription: The creature lies in a stinking black pool of blood. Its yellow eyes and its jaws of dagger-like teeth are open, but the creature is dead. Its gloved fingers are long and tipped with bony claws. This must be a goblin.

prop.description: A man in leather armor is doubled over near the locked door. He is your guide. His raspy breath grows ever weaker.
prop.detailedDescription: Through bubbling gasps, he speaks, "The dark laughter drew me to this place. What misfortune lead you thirteen children to this golbins' nest? And I have rescued but one of you. That goblin there felled me even as I felled him. A path I hewed through the armed goblin guard to reach this depth. Accend the stair and be free. But what of the other twelve?"
